headline: The Perfect Basic Burger
description: These burger patties are simply seasoned and ready to grill in minutes. Enjoy on ciabatta, Kaiser, or potato rolls topped with your favorite condiments.

video.description: These burger patties are made with ground beef and an easy bread crumb mixture. Nothing beats a simple hamburger on a warm summer evening. Pile these burgers with your favorite condiments and pop open a cool drink!
video.name: The Perfect Basic Burger Recipe

name: The Perfect Basic Burger

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat and lightly oil grate.
Whisk together egg, salt, and pepper in a medium bowl.
Add ground beef and bread crumbs and mix with your hands or a fork until well blended.

Place patties on the preheated grill. Cover and cook 6 to 8 minutes per side, or to desired doneness. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 160 degrees F (70 degrees C).

Love it

I think it is very nice, I went with my family, they all loved it, if I lived in Toronto, I would go every day, but unfortunately I don't live in Toronto, I'm calling out to those who live in Toronto, I recommend you to go here immediately

The ingredients you have are fine, just don't use lean gd. beef ( need some fat ), I did add a little garlic powder( Its the It. . in me)The condiments are really what adds the goodness to burger, I also like to butter & grill my buns when sliced. That's pretty basic !!!

Saw a comment that talked about this being a tasteless burger. Not sure how that could be!! So I cold smoked this recipes for 30 minutes (15 per side as I keep the meat real close to the ice tray) and then did a reverse sear to bring the meat up to 115-120 deg on a 225 temp grill then seared them a minute on each side in the cast iron skillet. While this may not be a basic cook, it is a great recipe that is super yummy when done!
OK.
Simple. Tasty. The whole family loves it.

We’ve made these a few times now. The kids love it every time. Despite the basic ingredients list it’s an absolutely delicious burger, especially when dressed up with some toppings! We add spinach, old cheddar cheese, onions, pickles, plus mustard and mayo. Sometimes jalapeños too.

This is a great basic burger recipe! A really excellent one to use with toppings and condiments. It was super easy to prepare and to cook up (we have no grill so I used a front t pan). It's also a great one to build off of. I've added some diced cooked onion and Worcestershire and it was delicious.
It was an amazing burger, yes I also added Hamburger spice, only a couple shakes, and it was perfect. Would STRONGLY recommend.
I was looking for a simple burger recipe Using things I had on hand. Very good delicious burgers. Thank you!
Solid basic hamburger mix, thoroughly enjoyed. This mix produces a moist burger. We topped ours with a hamburger seasoning blend before cooking.

Followed recipe closely. Good hamburgers. Rarely do I use bread crumbs. Makes a texture a little too smooth for me but very nice. One note of which to be aware: The recipe calls for 6-8 minutes a side! My ordinary outdoor propane three burner grill: 3-4 a side and more than medium rare.

I thought this recipe was good, I had to remove the salt in this recipe as it causes ibs symptoms, still turned out yummy. I also made the ratio of meat change for my small stomach, and made the change from grill to stovetop.
So simple, turns out delicious and is a big hit every time!
This made the nastiest, soggiest burger I’ve ever had. I couldn’t even finish half of it.
The burgers overall were good, but we couldn't get past the meatloaf texture.
I thought this burger was very tasty as long as you use good quality meat
excellent starting point for a burger with lots of condiments - we had mozzarella, pickles, mayo, chilli sauce, mustard and an oozy fried egg!
Pretty respectable burger. I think I’ll add a little onion powder next time to add a little more depth to the flavor. It was definitely a good burger, though.

This is an excellent starting point for a burger you can really make your own. Use only the egg yolk, and it will hold together with add ins (diced jalapenos and shredded cheese for me). Some people are puritans about making a burger with only beef, but these always come out tender and tasty, while the pure beef ones shrink like crazy and are often plain and dont hold together if you like to add things. I also add a bit of worchestershire to the mix.
I added Valentina hot sauce to the mix. They were very tasty. Great basic burger recipe.

This recipe is properly named as it was the perfect basic burger. Easy to throw together because of the basic pantry ingredients. I did not find the burger bland but as others have mentioned you can build your flavor with condiments etc. I plated the burgers and set out a mini burger bar of condiments and add ons such as lettuce, pickle tomato, onion and spicy ketchup. Everyone gets to build their own burger. Even though I’ve been cooking burgers for years my husband was wowed by this burger. I will use this recipe going forward for burger nights. I did cook it stove top due to inclement weather.
Super tasty and easy.

I made this Perfect Basic Burger recipe for my 14 year old son and he loved it! The burger had excellent flavor! I did add a sprinkling of garlic salt and freshly ground pepper on the top of the burgers while it was cooking. My son likes cheese on his burgers so I also added a slice of Sharp Cheddar Cheese. I loved the simplicity of this recipe and the fact that I had all the ingredients at home. Will definitely make this recipe again :).
Simple, easy and quick. I baked them in the oven, and they turned out perfect.
I made this today. My girls love it!

Was looking for a quick, easy, last-minute burger when I ran out of pre-made ones and this recipe fit the bill perfectly! I just needed the basics and only added some additional spices (because what is cooking if you don't) and these turned out fantastically. A lot better than many other recipes I've tried. They were moist, held together well while cooking, and the flavouring was great.

Add little bit red pepper, switched salts to lawrys and onion powder for which I don't like onions except for onion rings??
Will make again
Yes
I actually added a package of dried onion soup mix to the burger mixture but otherwise made them exactly as directed. Really good. My go-to grilled burger recipe from now on.
Great basic burger recipe, I add a clove of minced garlic and use it for sliders.
Made according to the recipe, except I sprinkled some garlic salt and soy sauce on the patties prior to broiling.
These burgers are really good, I would make these again.

I put half of an egg instead of 1. I added spicy red pepper since i love spicy food. It is better if you mix the ingredients and put it to the fridge for a couple of hours before cooking. Thanks for the recipe.
Very basicwhich means you will definitely have the ingredients. I added one teaspoon Worcestershire sauce and it was great!
Made it for 2 servings by using only 200g of ground beef and keeping all the other ingredients at the instructed amount. Topped it with some melted cheese and it tastes great!!
The title says it all: it's perfect! Not too dry, not too gooey. I will remember this recipe!

This is fine, but please be aware that putting bread crumbs and eggs in your burgers will not be good for a lot of people: those with gluten sensitivity, wheat allergy, possibly soy allergy (many breads have soy) and egg allergy. If it's just for your family, great, but if it's for others, NOT GREAT. Stick with meat-only or list the ingredients (for the buns too) with warnings for the guests. Thanks from all of us with allergies!

My mom loves the old fashioned burgers where you can really taste the meat. This was perfect for her. She added her cheese, mustard, pickles, lettuce, tomatoes, onions and toasted bun and she was asking for another. Thank you for this simple recipe.

My husband made these for my Mom and I for Mother’s Day and they were delicious! He baked them at 425 in the oven rather than bbqing them. The only suggestion I have is to make the patties very flat as they ‘shrink and rise’ a lot during cooking.
These burgers are amazing! I only added a few shakes of montreal steak seasoning, but otherwise followed the recipe exactly. This is now my go to burger recipe.

I thought this recipe was ON POINT. A simple burger that doesn't take away from your toppings. My kids felt it was "weird" so maybe ill experiment with some seasonings to cater to their odd taste buds. I reheated it the next day and it tasted even better. Thank you.

FINALLY, this is the one! I have been trying different recipes for years to make the perfect burger patty, I used most the bells and whistles out there, non of it was even close to being right, but this simple little recipe was just perfect. This is the taste I have been looking for. 
Ps: I used 1/2 tsp of pepper and 1 tsp salt.
Thank you
a little on the peppery side...but that might be bc I wasn't sure if I had a full lb of hamburger. i used homemade breadcrumbs and it was delicious overall!

This is a great, easy recipe that makes tender, juicy burgers. The only change I made was to add 2 tsp of A1 steak sauce for a little extra flavor after mixing all the ingredients to grass-fed angus beef. Those who complained that the burgers tasted bland might have bought cheap meat or didn't cook them correctly. Making thin patties and then melting cheese on top with sauteed mushrooms is my favorite way to have burgers at home.
Love this recipe. Tonight, made with seasoned salt and 1/4 tsp pepper with grass fed beef 85%. On grill. Topped w/blue cheese dressing and a pickle.
Nothing special. Just okay

This was such a great easy recipe. My 12 year old wanted to make burgers for supper so I was looking for a straight forward recipe for her to follow. The only change we made was the addition of some garlic powder. Next time we will make 6 burgers rather than 4 as they were pretty big for us.

Save the breadcrumbs for your meatloaf. I'm sure this is great if meatloaf burger is what your going for. Myself I just add Worcestershire and liquid smoke (salt & Pepper of course) or sometimes some onion soup mix if I want to get fancy. 

I'm already eating enough bread in the bun without adding it to the inside of the burger as well. JMO

You have to be very careful not to blend the mixture more than you need to. Just gently fold the seasonings into the meat. Gently form the patties. Don't squish them between your hands. You want to preserve the spaces between the bits of ground meat because that is where the juice ends up. If you mix the meat into a smooth homogeneous mass, the juice will run out into the fire.
It's great! Especially if you have ground beef you need to use up and you're in need of a basic hamburger.
I gave it only 4 stars because some times I add some spices depending on the taste of my guests

Great basic burger. I've done two tricks in addition to this recipe. I've added 1/4 cup of water to plain ground beef which helps with the dryness and omits the bread crumb/egg and have also asked the meat guy at the market to grind chuck for me. GOOD quality beef is what makes this recipe a winner along with NOT overmixing/
overhandling. I've also asked the meat guy to grind flap meat ONCE, added 2 Tablespoons of melted butter and formed patties that way. All good. Thanks for the recipe. Not all of us like "gourmet" for a quick meal.
This recipe with an egg and bread crumbs should be called a meatloaf burger. I like meatloaf, but when I am looking for a tender juicy burger, i don't want fillers in it.
Good basic burger! So yummy with American cheese, fresh lettuce and tomato. Some days it's nice to just have a simple, basic meal. Thank you for sharing.

Excellent base burger. I added a few extra seasonings to give it the flavour I wanted, but by keeping what was in it basic, it held together well on the BBQ. I personally used seasoning salt instead of regular salt and added 1/2 tsp of onion and garlic powders. Yum!
Best burgers i've made in a long time!!
MMM, tasty. I make this burger with hamburger press http://hamburgerpressstore.com/top-5-burger-patty-press/
Good burgers, I added more spices and some Ketchup.
Really good burger! The family enjoyed them...a keeper~YUM! Thanks for sharing. :)
Good basic recipe. I add worchestershire.

Yes, it can use tweaks, but it *is* listed as the perfect BASIC burger....and for that, it is just as the title exclaimed. I used a few spices and some finely diced onion, followed the rest of the recipe down to the letter. They came out firm, juicy and, well...perfect :)
Tasteless
My first time making burgers and they turned out really good. It was quick and easy and my family loved it!
YES!! The perfect burger recipe. This burger is excellent- hubby and kids gave it 5 stars, along with me! This is my new go-to recipe for homemade burgers. Simply amazing!
Burgers came out perfectly; didn't change a thing. Rainy Fourth of July, so I pan fried these on medium heat in a cast iron skillet. My two year old tore it up! Thanks sugar for the recipe.
Be sure to add 1/2 tsp milk to egg and bread and beat together BEFORE adding meat and seasonings.
I didn't use as much bread crumbs, but this is a perfect base recipe.
Amazing and perfect I made it on the stove top without any issues.

Super simple and super tasty. 
I ran out of breadcrumbs so used panko instead which I think helped hold the patties together better. 
Dividing 500g into 4 gave me very thick patties. Perfect for a man sized burger.
Loved it!

I thought I was going to have a real mess on my hands until I added the bread crumbs at the end. It seemed like a lot when I read it, but it worked out perfectly, the patties shaped up easily and the burgers cooked up deliciously.
I thought it was amazing it tastes divine. It doesn't have a gourmet taste but if you add the right toppings it is wonderful. Bye-Bye McDonald's.

My family prefers a simple but tasty burger, and this hits the spot every time. I add a little worcestershire sauce and garlic powder and it gives it a little more flavor, but not enough to confuse or overstimulate your mouth like other burger recipes. This recipe works best with real beef, not Walmart , and is perfect for those that appreciate the natural flavor of good meat in a burger. If you're looking for a quick, easy and tasty burger recipe, this is a great pick- I make it once a week and know it by heart now :) thanks for sharing!
I have never made homemade burgers before. I've already made these twice. Simple, easy and delicious. This is a keeper.
Just made this burger the only thing I tweaked was I added garlic powder to it. And my girls said it was the best burger they ever eaten. Lol it was good and simple to make.

Great basic burger recipe with ingredients you probably have. I added 1/2 tsp of garlic powder and 1/2 tsp of worstershire and they were great. My family likes simple flavors and they loved these burgers!
this is my favorite burger recipe.
We added garlic powder to it but it's super yummy

I wasn't expecting much from such a simple recipe but it was DELICIOUS. My whole family really loved this and it will be our go to recipe for sure. Could not be easier and it was very tasty. You will not be disappointed with this burger. YUM!
I loved these, I did add a few ingredients for flavor: 1/2 tsp of both onion & garlic powder, and 1/2 tsp of liquid smoke. goodluck ;)

SO DELICIOUS. This is definitely my new go to burger recipe. I cooked mine in a pan on the stove. Simple, quick, delicious, and oh so juicy! I love a soft juicy burger that melts in my mouth and these definitely fit the bill.

This is the Perfect Burger I never could get it right now I can I cooked it on the stovetop can't wait to try it on the grill. Add your condiments and whatever else you like on top and its more then Perfect. If you are looking for a gourmet one look somewhere else.
Made these for 20 people including kids. Lots of compliments. Thanks!
This was simple but delicious! I added a tsp of Worcester Sauce but will likely add 1 1/2 tsp. next time to add a little zing. Yum!
This was a great recipe for a basic burger! Only thing I added was worcester sauce!

Just made this for dinner, I made a whole pound thinking I could eat a half pound burger, but now I have to GLADLY save the other half for tomorrow! I also made another one for my friend who eats a bit more than me, and he gobbled down his burger!

Tip! When making this stir in the bread crumbs last, I made the mistake of mixing them in prior to mixing the meat, and it was too thick (but I also live in a dry climate, so if that happens to you, add a little water after mixing in the meat, like a teaspoon, and that should fix everything)! 

Great recipe! :D

This is how my mom made burgers 40 years ago, long before the advent of tossing in exotic (and sometimes disgusting) international ingredients with the ground meat. It's the way I make burgers. 

The burger is meant to be a blank slate and all the rest of the weird, trendy stuff people eat now is reserved for topping it. I have a refrigerator full of condiments and cheeses family and friends can choose from for burger toppings (you'd be surprised at the wide, eclectic selection and varying heat levels), but none of these will ever be mixed in with the burger meat itself. Obviously this must work because I haven't gotten any complaints yet, and I've been making burgers this way since high school.

Great, BASIC recipe. This recipe doesn't claim to be gourmet, it claims to be BASIC. I was looking for a plain burger that is not complicated or that doesn't have a million ingredients. We like our burgers with lettuce, tomato, ketchup and mustard and those toppings just don't work when you are making gourmet patties. We LOVED this. It will be my go to burger. The burgers stuck together REALLY nicely, easy to make. Hands down, this recipe is exactly as claimed in the title.
A very simple, fast, tasty burger. I added some garlic powder, basil and oregeno.

These burgers were absolutely perfect. The amount show isn't exact unless you want to make really big and thick burgers. I have a uncle who cooks at restaurants and he finds these burgers to be better than his!

I doubled the recipe and added one onion, a tsp of Lea & Perrins Worcester sauce, and a dash or two of hot sauce. They were simple but tasty and very juicy. Great for a cook-out where you want to please everyone!

Definitely the perfect basic burger! I used Panko brand bread crumbs, and none of my guests could tell that there were any in this recipe. Even my picky DD ate her entire burger without prodding for a change. Great recipe! Ignore the poor reviews. :-) Thank you for sharing!
Egg makes the burger taste like a meatloaf, ok recipe.
I think this burger is just great if you add your own personality to it. A great staple recipe.
Gave it a try and was very disappointed. Not juicy and due to the breadcrumbs it had a texture closer to a processed chicken patty. Sorry, not a hit with our family.
great simple burger - just what I was looking for. pan grilled it and put it on a toasted english muffin. all it needed was a slice of cheese. yum!
